02. Of late a few of incidents alleging misbehavior against CISF personnel
have come to notice, Therefore, during VIP movement, a very tactful and
matured approach is required to be adopted by our staff in their duties. The
following instructions are being issued in this regard.

|. CASO or the Sr. most GO present during the movement must proactively
co-ordinate with representatives of all the agencies in advance about the
movement, especially the issues pertaining to accessibility of the
receiving and send-off groups, their passes , routes etc. These minute
details should be briefed to all the ‘concerned ASG personnel deployed
for the VIP movement. There should be no confusion/ambiguity/doubt
about these issues amongst the deployed ASG personnel. Any last
minute change or deviation in these matters should be immediately
conveyed to all concemed. .

All duty personnel deployed for VIP movement should be well versed with
the latest security guidelines/procedures in vogue and they shoud

understand their limits and jurisdictions.

Exclusively earmarked personnel from CIW may be detailed covertly in
plain clothes for intelligence/surveillance. But, under no circumstances,

they should indulge in active public interaction during their duties.

Specifically earmarked staff should be deployed for duties during VIP
movement and proper briefing and debriefing of the duty personnel

should be done by the senior mast GO in this regard.

Though, all duty personnel deployed for airport duties have to remain firm
towards their duties and behave in a decent/polite manner, they should
remain extra cautious towards their tone, tenor, body language and

gestures during their deployment for VIP movement.

‘All CASOs will ensure strict compliance of the above instructions.
